t: Psalm 94
The Lord Will Not Forsake His People
O*pn Lord,*s God of vengeance, O*ld God of vengeance, shine forth!
Rise*ln up, O judge of the earth; repay*ld to the proud what they deserve!
O*ln Lord,*s how long shall the wicked, how*ld long shall the wicked exult?
They*ln pour out their arrogant words; all*ld the evildoers boast.
They*ln crush your people, O Lord,*s and*ld afflict your heritage.
They*ln kill the widow and the sojourner, and*ld murder the fatherless;
and*ln they say, “The Lord*s does not see; the*ld God of Jacob does not perceive.”
Understand,*pn O dullest of the people! Fools,*ld when will you be wise?
He*ln who planted the ear, does he not hear? He*ln who formed the eye, does he not see?
He*ln who disciplines the nations, does he not rebuke? He*ln who teaches man knowledge—
the*ld Lord—*s knows the thoughts of man, that*ld they are but a breath.
Blessed*pn is the man whom you discipline, O Lord,*s and*ld whom you teach out of your law,
to*ln give him rest from days of trouble, until*ld a pit is dug for the wicked.
For*ln the Lord*s will not forsake his people; he*ld will not abandon his heritage;
for*ln justice will return to the righteous, and*ld all the upright in heart will follow it.
Who*pn rises up for me against the wicked? Who*ld stands up for me against evildoers?
If*ln the Lord*s had not been my help, my*ld soul would soon have lived in the land of silence.
When*ln I thought, “My foot slips,” your*ld steadfast love, O Lord,*s held me up.
When*ln the cares of my heart are many, your*ld consolations cheer my soul.
Can*ln wicked rulers be allied with you, those*ld who frame injustice by statute?
They*ln band together against the life of the righteous and*ld condemn the innocent to death.
But*ln the Lord*s has become my stronghold, and*ld my God the rock of my refuge.
He*ln will bring back on them their iniquity and*ld wipe them out for their wickedness; the*ld Lord*s our God will wipe them out.
